DataElement.preferredName: DNA Assessment In Situ Hybridization Assay Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type of DNA or RNA assay to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A deoxyribonucleotide polymer that is the primary genetic material of all cells. Eukaryotic and prokaryotic organisms normally contain DNA in a double-stranded state, yet several important biological processes transiently involve single-stranded regions. DNA, which consists of a polysugar-phosphate backbone possessing projections of purines (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidines (thymine and cytosine), forms a double helix that is held together by hydrogen bonds between these purines and pyrimidines (adenine to thymine and guanine to cytosine).

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Changed long name ot EVS Preferred Name.  DW

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type of DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable. Interphase is considered the resting stage of the cell.

Concepts.definition: The interval between two successive cell divisions during which the chromosomes are not individually distinguishable. Interphase is considered the resting stage of the cell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.

Concepts.definition: The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues:The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.
A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
